member.name: T:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor
member.summary: Class used for managing requests on the device portal api of a windows iot operating system.

member.name: P:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor.Networking
member.summary: Gets the networking processor that contains request methods related to networking.

member.name: P:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor.RemoteControl
member.summary: Gets the networking processor that contains request methods related to networking.

member.name: P:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor.OSInformation
member.summary: Gets the Operating System Information processor that contains request methods related to the operating system of the device.

member.name: M:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class and stores the device portal url that will be used by all device portal request methods.
member.param: The device portal url. E.g. if the manager is used from an application within the windows iot, the address will be localhost. And if it is on a raspberry pi, then the default address and port should be "http://localhost:8080/". The slash at the end is optional and automatically concatenated if missing.
Username with authority on the device portal.

member.name: M:DevicePortalCoreSDK.DevicePortalProcessor.#ctor(System.String,System.Net.NetworkCredential)
member.summary: Creates an instance of the class and stores the device portal url that will be used by all device portal request methods.
member.param: The device portal url. E.g. if the manager is used from an application within the windows iot, the address will be localhost. And if it is on a raspberry pi, then the default address and port should be "http://localhost:8080/". The slash at the end is optional and automatically concatenated if missing.
The credentials that will be used by the processor.
